intro: Acroceras mandrarense, commonly known as the Mediterranean sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs. Acroceras mandrarense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
